sentences.chinese: 我們爲我們的勝利而歡欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: A great poem is a fountain forever overflowing with the waters of wisdom and delight (P.B.Shelley, British poet)
sentences.chinese: 偉大的詩篇即是永遠噴出智慧和歡欣之水的噴泉。

sentences.english: Rightists don’t revel in the plight of workers either.
sentences.chinese: 右派也不會對工人階層所處的窘境而歡欣。

sentences.english: A young men and women and rejoice, bundles bright-coloured rose itch to try.
sentences.chinese: 一個個年輕男女歡欣鼓舞，一束束鮮豔玫瑰躍躍欲試。

sentences.english: I could see so clearly from your light-footed running to me that you must have had a joy in your heart.
sentences.chinese: 從你輕快的步履，我能清楚地知道你內心的歡欣。

sentences.english: He exulted in his younger sister's success.
sentences.chinese: 他爲妹妹的成功而歡欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: The ball fans rejoiced over the news of their team's victory.
sentences.chinese: 這些球迷聽到他們球隊勝利的消息而歡欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: My love dances in my beautiful hair.
O come, all ye faithful, joyful and triumphant.
sentences.chinese: 齊來宗主信徒，快樂又歡欣。

sentences.english: In a moment they were all out of the chaise, rejoicing at the sight of each other.
sentences.chinese: 一剎眼工夫，他們都下了車，賓主相見，無限歡欣。

sentences.english: The day Bunkie was fired there was great rejoicing and much drinking of champagne.
sentences.chinese: 邦奇被解僱的那天，大家歡欣鼓舞，痛飲香檳。

sentences.english: Few people would not exult at the abolition of slavery.
sentences.chinese: 奴隸制被廢除了，人們無不爲之歡欣鼓舞。

sentences.english: Or doth the throstle sing with more glee , At daybreak than a twilight?
sentences.chinese: 亦或畫眉在破曉時分的歡欣，盛於薄暮時的歌唱？

sentences.english: You played out your happiness bit on a piano that was not infinite.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在有限的鋼琴上奏出你的歡欣快樂。

definition: to return from a rewarding journey
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
